title: Evergrande Averts Default Again by Making Second Late Payment
sub_head: Indebted developer pays $45 million before end of grace period
body:
China Evergrande Group avoided default for a second time by making an overdue interest payment on dollar bonds shortly before the end of a 30-day grace period, people familiar with the matter said.
Evergrande, one of Chinaâ€™s largest real-estate developers, made a coupon payment that was originally due on Sept. 29, the people said. Evergrande was on the hook to pay about $45 million of interest on $951 million of bonds, which have a 9.5% coupon and mature in 2024, according to CreditSights research.
